channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Mystery drones flying over New Jersey have residents and officials puzzled
item.description: The drones have been seen above critical infrastructure like reservoirs, rail stations and military bases. The governor says there is "no known threat," but the FBI is still investigating.
item.content:encoded:
The drones have been seen above critical infrastructure like reservoirs, rail stations and military bases. The governor says there is "no known threat," but the FBI is still investigating.

(Image credit: Scott Ingenito)
item.dc:creator: Jason Breslow

item.title: Police say gun found with suspect matches casings at UnitedHealthcare CEO crime scene
item.description: The New York police commissioner also said investigators matched Luigi Mangione's fingerprints with those found on items near the scene where the UnitedHealthcare CEO was fatally shot last week.
item.content:encoded:
The New York police commissioner also said investigators matched Luigi Mangione's fingerprints with those found on items near the scene where the UnitedHealthcare CEO was fatally shot last week.

(Image credit: Stefan Jeremiah)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: FBI Director Wray to resign at end of Biden administration
item.description: Wray told employees at an FBI town hall that he is resigning next month to "avoid dragging the Bureau deeper into the fray." President-elect Donald Trump called the resignation "a great day for America."
item.content:encoded:
Wray told employees at an FBI town hall that he is resigning next month to "avoid dragging the Bureau deeper into the fray." President-elect Donald Trump called the resignation "a great day for America."

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: The U.S. is facing a severe housing shortage. Will Trump's proposals help?
item.description: The U.S. is short approximately four million homes. Wharton economist Ben Keys traces the beginning of the housing crisis to the 2008 financial meltdown — and says climate change is making things worse.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. is short approximately four million homes. Wharton economist Ben Keys traces the beginning of the housing crisis to the 2008 financial meltdown — and says climate change is making things worse.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Saudi Arabia will host the 2034 FIFA World Cup — a controversial pick
item.description: FIFA's selection of Saudi Arabia to host the World Cup was celebrated in the kingdom but criticized by human rights groups, who fear residents, visitors and migrant workers will be at risk of abuse.
item.content:encoded:
FIFA's selection of Saudi Arabia to host the World Cup was celebrated in the kingdom but criticized by human rights groups, who fear residents, visitors and migrant workers will be at risk of abuse.

(Image credit: Mahmoud Khaled)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: A Wisconsin kayaker accused of faking his death appears in court
item.description: Ryan Borgwardt disappeared in August while kayaking in Wisconsin, but an investigation revealed he intended to fake his death and had fled to Europe. Police said he willingly returned to the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
Ryan Borgwardt disappeared in August while kayaking in Wisconsin, but an investigation revealed he intended to fake his death and had fled to Europe. Police said he willingly returned to the U.S.

(Image credit: Green Lake County Sheriff Office)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: In South Korea, insurrection charges are closing in on the president
item.description: Police, prosecutors and investigators have deemed President Yoon Suk Yeol as a suspect in a rare investigation into a sitting president for possible insurrection charges.
item.content:encoded:
Police, prosecutors and investigators have deemed President Yoon Suk Yeol as a suspect in a rare investigation into a sitting president for possible insurrection charges.

(Image credit: SeongJoon Cho)
item.dc:creator: Se Eun Gong

item.title: Kimberly Guilfoyle is the latest Trump family ally chosen for an ambassadorship
item.description: Kimberly Guilfoyle, who got engaged to Trump's son in 2020, is the latest appointee he's chosen from his family tree. There's a long and controversial history of presidents picking relatives for jobs.
item.content:encoded:
Kimberly Guilfoyle, who got engaged to Trump's son in 2020, is the latest appointee he's chosen from his family tree. There's a long and controversial history of presidents picking relatives for jobs.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Albertsons sues Kroger and ends failed grocery megamerger
item.description: The lawsuit over a deal to combine the two largest U.S. supermarkets came just a day after it was blocked in both federal and Washington state courts.
item.content:encoded:
The lawsuit over a deal to combine the two largest U.S. supermarkets came just a day after it was blocked in both federal and Washington state courts.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: Clues to Luigi Mangione's ideology. And, courts halt Kroger and Albertsons megamerger
item.description: Murder suspect Luigi Mangione's digital footprint could provide clues to his ideology and possible motive. And, what's next for Kroger and Albertsons after courts halt megamerger.
item.content:encoded:
Murder suspect Luigi Mangione's digital footprint could provide clues to his ideology and possible motive. And, what's next for Kroger and Albertsons after courts halt megamerger.

(Image credit: Hussein Malla)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
